sentences.english: You can tell the very rich by their evening dress.
sentences.chinese: 你可從夜禮服認出那些極有錢的富人。

sentences.english: The new policy will not touch the rich.
sentences.chinese: 新政策不會對富人有影響。

sentences.english: The law does not discriminate against the poor in favour of the rich.
sentences.chinese: 法律絕不歧視窮人而偏袒富人。

sentences.english: We know what the rich man says.
sentences.chinese: 那個富人總是說話算話。

sentences.english: The dainties of the great are the tears of the poor.
sentences.chinese: 富人口中的美味是窮人眼中的淚水。

sentences.english: B lamb is as dear to a poor man as an ox to the rich.
sentences.chinese: 貧平易近眼中的一隻羊，貴似富人一頭牛。

sentences.english: Laws grind the poor, and rich men rule the law. (Oliver Goldsmith, British writer)
sentences.chinese: 法律吸吮窮人的膏血，而富人卻掌握着權柄。

sentences.english: At every level, the rich now have much better access to good education than the less well-off.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎麼說，富人總是擁有更高的機會進入好學校。

sentences.english: Poverty could not be eliminated by soaking the rich.
sentences.chinese: 貧窮是不能靠對富人的巧取豪奪來消滅的。

sentences.english: The house are small and mean. Large house are very few and belong to rich men.
sentences.chinese: 屋子小兒平常，大屋很少而且都是富人的。

sentences.english: Several-hundred activists took part, demanding an end to tax havens for the rich.
sentences.chinese: 遊行得人們要求結束爲富人設定的減免稅政策。

sentences.english: The building of this house in the shape of the temple was a rich man's vagary .
sentences.chinese: 這棟房屋廟宇式的外形，是一位富人的奇想。

sentences.english: And out of the $800 million that Obama raised, $700 million came from corporations and rich donors.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬徵募的8億競選費，有7億是來自公司和富人。

sentences.english: The building of this house in the shape of the temple was a rich man's vagary .
sentences.chinese: 富人的奇思異想是，修建的房子形狀像廟子。

sentences.english: I wander thro' each charter ' d street.
sentences.chinese: 我徘徊在每一條富人專用的街上。

sentences.english: Britain's Rich Listers lost about 38% of their wealth.
sentences.chinese: 英國富人損失了約38%的資產。

definition: the benevolent man cannot be rich (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
